skill.name: git-protocol
skill.description: Git protocol implementation patterns using gitoxide for Guts repository operations
skill.summary: Git protocol implementation patterns using gitoxide for Guts repository operations
skill.author: AbdelStark

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing markdown guidance and Rust code examples. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. All content is informational patterns for Git protocol implementation.

content.value_statement: Building Git-compatible operations requires understanding complex protocols and object models. This skill provides ready-to-use patterns for repository operations, pack file handling, and Smart HTTP protocol implementation using the pure Rust gitoxide library.
actual_capabilities: Open and create Git repositories with gitoxide
Work with Git objects (blobs, trees, commits, tags)
Implement Smart HTTP protocol endpoints for clone and push
Generate and parse pack files for data transfer
Manage Git references and branch operations
Build Guts extensions with cryptographic commit signatures
limitations: Focuses on gitoxide library patterns, not git command execution
Does not cover Git LFS or large file handling
Examples are illustrative patterns, not production-ready implementations
Does not include GitHub API integration or authentication flows

output_examples.input: How do I create a new Git repository and write a commit using gitoxide?
output: Use gix::init_bare() to create a new bare repository
Build a CommitRef with tree, parents, author, and message

best_practices: Use bare repositories for server-side Git operations to avoid working directory issues
Implement atomic reference updates with compare-and-swap for concurrent access
Verify cryptographic signatures on commits for security in decentralized systems
Use content-addressed object storage for deduplication and integrity
anti_patterns: Running git commands via shell instead of using gitoxide APIs directly
Ignoring object deduplication when writing large numbers of blobs
Skipping signature verification in multi-validator consensus environments
Using mutable references to Repository in concurrent async contexts

faq.question: What is gitoxide?
faq.answer: Gitoxide is a pure Rust implementation of Git. It provides safe, fast, and correct Git operations without spawning external git processes.

faq.question: Can this skill help with git command line usage?
faq.answer: No. This skill focuses on implementing Git protocol operations programmatically using the gitoxide library, not on using git CLI commands.

faq.question: What Git protocol features are covered?
faq.answer: Smart HTTP protocol endpoints, pack file generation and parsing, object handling, reference management, and cryptographic commit signatures.

faq.question: Is the code production ready?
faq.answer: The patterns serve as starting points. Production code needs additional error handling, permission checks, rate limiting, and security audits.

faq.question: Does this work with existing Git repositories?
faq.answer: Yes. Gitoxide can read and write to standard Git repositories. Back up data before making modifications to existing repos.

faq.question: How is this different from libgit2?
faq.answer: Gitoxide is written in pure Rust with better safety guarantees, async support, and a more ergonomic API compared to the C-based libgit2.
